dublin_core.dcvalue: Stroke is the fourth leading cause of death in the United States On average someone has a stroke every 40 seconds The gaps for patients diagnosed with a stroke are the availability of physicians who specialize in stroke care and access to evidence based stroke care Telemedicine has assisted in bridging this gap to provide effective stroke treatment The purpose of this article is to describe how the implementation of a hub and spoke model using telemedicine has assisted in increasing patient access to neurology expertise and receiving evidence based treatment of recombinant tissue plasminogen activator thereby improving patient outcomes
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-07T13:31:40Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2014-12-02
Critical care nursing clinics of North America
Stroke care using a hub and spoke model with telemedicine.
